Text: The Brazilians and Australians players are now attending the fans requests.
For the Australian side Thomas Edgar was the top scorer with 14 points
Next Sunday (june 07) Brazil and Australia will meet again in São Bernardo do Campo (Brazil) at 10 am - local time.
The Brazilian opposite spiker, Evandro Guerra, is the top scorer of the match. He made 19 points.
Despite the defeat the volleyroos get some warm applauses from the stands.
And that's it. With a block, Team Brazil ends the set, 25-18 and the match 3-1.
Williams made a clean block over Evandro's spike. Australia need more to be alive on the game. 24-18.
Team Brazil is only two points away from its third victory in three games.
Lipe Fonteles flies like a hummingbird to score once more. 21-16
Williams stoped Murilo Endres. Brazil is still ahead. 19-13
The two teams are performing a great defense festival, but Brazilians have more efficiency on counter-attacks. 17-10
Samuel Walker made an outstanding goalkeeper like save, but the volleyroos missed the counter-attack.
The crowd lighted up with the good moment of the home team and is making a loud noise!
Evandro uses his 207 cm high to overcome the australian blockers. 12-9
Samuel Walker spikes to bring Australia back. 9-8
Riad went fast and furious to hit the ball and scored. Brazil is ahead. TTO 8-6
A long rally ended with Samuel Walker's strike. 5-5
Ace by Evandro! The only skill he didn't score yet. 2-5
Australians opened the count on fourth set. 0-1
After Nehemiah Mote missed the seved, the Brazilians won the third set, 25-19
Riad showed why he was the top blocker in the last Brazil's Superliga and shut the door for the volleyroos and scores with two block in a row. 20-15
With a single block Murilo Endres stoped Thomas "Tom D-P" Douglas-Powel. 17-14
Brazilians needed to try twice to overcome Australia's wall and be ahead at the second TTO on set three. 16-14.
Samuel Walker dropped the ball in the Brazilian side and scores. 13-12
A long range set by William Arjona finished with a Lipe Fonteles' strong spike. 12-11
A counter-attack by Lipe Fonteles let Brazil ahead for the first time on third set. 11-10

Team Brazil - Riad in 

Lucas Saatkamp out
Evandro misses the opportunity and the volleyroos scored. 9-10
Lucas Saatkamp stops Paul Sanderson. 8-8
The volleyroos liked to be ahead and are keeping the leash on the first TTO of the third set. 6-8
Outstanding block by Murilo Endres. 6-6
The Australian reception improved making Grigory Sukochev work easier. 5-6
Thomas Edgar scores an ace. 3-4
The Volleyroos have a huge challenge ahead playing against the nine-times World League winners, but they look very confindent. Don't they?
The block is the Australian key for their reaction. The volleyroos scored five times with this skill and Brazil just three.
Wallace strikes the ball out, but Brazilians ask for challenge. But the video confirms that the ball out. Australia get the second set. 21-25
Even the most experienced players can make an error! Sergio Santos misses the reception and the Australians are getting close to end the set. 21-23
Eder ends the rally and it's a tie! The Australia Team's coach, Roberto Santilli, calls a time-out. 21-21
Australian block stops the Brazilian spike and the volleyroos keep leading the set. 19-21
Roberley Leonaldo asked for a video challenge and the video shows thar there was a last touch by the australian side. 18-19
Long rally with a incredible save by William Arjona and with a ball setted by Lucas Saatkamp, Lipe Fonteles scores. 17-19

Team Australia - Roberts in

Sanderson out
After Team Brazil made three points in a row, Roberto Santilli asks a time-out 14-16
William "the wizard" Arjona fools the Australian blockers and let Lipe Fonteles free to spike! 12-16
TTO. The volleyroos improved their game and are keeping the leash on the second set. 11-16.
Evandro flies to hitt the ball with no chances for the australian defense. 10-14
Roberley "Rubinho" Leonaldo stops the game to try to put Brazil back on track. 9-14
After a "mission impossible" like defense by Sergio Santos, Lipe Fonteles scores for the home team. 9-12
Murilo Endres uses the australian block to score. 8-11
Brazil's backline hesitates and the ball slowly falls. 7-10
Edgar spikes from the right side and the volleyroos are still ahead. 2-3
The volleyroos started the second set's scoreboard. 2-0
The Brazilian service was more effective on the first set - three points - while the Australians scored just once with that skill.
Lipe Fonteles, on a counter-attack, ends the set for the Southamericans. 25-20
Lipe Fonteles upsets the volleyroos' reception. Brazil is close to end the first set. 24-20
The australian opposite spiker, Williams scores his first point. 22-20

Team Brazil Raphael and Wallace in

Evandro and Wiliam out

Team Australia - Williams and Bell in

Sukochev and Edgar out
The volleyroos stoped Evandro with a three-men wall! 18-16
Team Brazil's captain, Murilo Endres, scores another and its TTO! 16-14
Samuel Walker hitts the ball to score for Australia. The volleyroos are back on track. 14-13
Lucas Saatkamp strikes an ace. and the Australia's coach, Roberto Santilli, asks fot a time-out. 14-11.
After a fail reception from Australia, Brazil is back ahead on the scoreboard. 11-10
Paul Sanderson started the rally with a strong serve and finished with a sharp spike. 8-9
The first TTO of this match comes after a missed service from Australian side. 8-7
Murilo uses the australian block to score. So far the match is tight. 7-6.
Team Brazil comes on court with Evandro, Wiliam, Murilo, Lipe Fonteles, Lucas Saatkamp,Eder and the libero Sergio Santos
The volleyroos start with Guymer, Sanderson, Edgar, Mote, Walker, Sukovchev and the libero Perry.
The referees are Fabian Concia (ARG) and Yuri Ramirez (DOM)
National anthems!

The two teams' mascots meet right before the match!

Who is gonna win??
In 2012, Brazil played three matches in São Bernardo do Campo (FIN, CAN, POL) winning all three of them.
You can also follow us on social media! We are at Twitter, Facebook and Instagram!
The Brazillian stars few moments before go on court!
The children and Brazil's mascot, Zecaré are ready to cheer!

Australia have lost their last four World League matches (including their last two of 2014) and can lose five in a row for the first time since a streak of 14 successive defeats dating back to their World League debut in 1999.
Brazil have started their 2015 World League campaign with two wins over Serbia (3-2, 3-1). In 2014, they won only one of their first four matches.
The two teams are streching out and warming up.
Now its the volleyroos' turn to go inside under applauses.
Team Brazil comes to the court for the excitment of the fans!
Australia will also play their first World League match against a team from South America.

Brazil and Australia will meet for the first time in FIVB World League's history. The nine-times winners have the crowd in their favour, but the volleyroos won last year's FIVB World League Group 2 with a thrilling five setter game against France. Let's see what this match brings. Do you have any guess who will win this friday?
Hello, volleyball fans! We are at Ginásio Poliesportivo Adib Moysés Dib, in São Bernardo do Campo (Brazil) for Brazil v Australia for the FIVB World League 2015. The game will start in about an hour.
